bibl.author: John M. Rogers
bibl.title: John M. Rogers to Walt Whitman, 24 July 1875

revisionDesc.change: made basic checking changes to file

body.p:
I received your letter last EveEvening and was glad to hear from you but I am sorysorry to hear that you have sick so long I have been sick with the Chills & Fever I have had wine to day my wife and Child have gone home on a visit to her house at Norwalk ConnConnecticut have been gone cinsesince the 20th of June so I am
alone I am at the same employment yet I have plenty of work but the pay is small My boy was not very well before he went away he has been better cinesince they have been there they are near the Salt water my wife is well the young Lady you met with me at the CorCorner of Fulton and Cart StsStreets that is my wife. Last wensdayWednesday I went to Hartford to the reunion of the ConnConnecticut VetransVeterans and spent two days I met a good many of my old camradscomrades we had a good time there wawas asembledassembled about Four thousand at
charter Oak Park near Hartford. I have grown thin cincesince you last saw me I do not weigh so much in 125 lbspounds I have worked very hard this sumersummer and I do not think it agrees so well with me heredhere as it does near the salt water and I shall not stay here any longer than I can help so good bybye for this time
